The State Department announcement: The expert's verdict mentions that on February 7, 2020, the State Department announced that it had facilitated the transportation of nearly 17.8 tons of donated medical supplies to China. This official statement serves as evidence to verify the claim.
Contents of the donation: The expert's verdict also mentions that the donated medical supplies included masks, gowns, gauze, respirators, and other vital materials. This specific information further supports the authenticity of the claim.
Confirmation of assistance: The expert's verdict states that the United States government announced its commitment to spend up to $100 million in existing funds to assist China and other impacted countries in containing and combating the novel coronavirus. This confirmation of assistance reinforces the credibility of the claim.
Previous investments in health security: The expert's verdict highlights that the United States, through USAID, has invested over one billion dollars in strengthening the capacity of more than 25 countries to prevent, detect, and respond to infectious diseases. This information demonstrates the United States' ongoing efforts in health security and adds credibility to the claim.
